title: BBC Local Live: Norfolk on Friday, 11 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: devolution for the region is likely to go ahead , the bbc understands .
the a1064 near acle has reopened after a sewage tanker overturned in a ditch .
charities helping victims of sexual abuse claim funding for their work is becoming harder to find .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it from the norfolk live team on friday so goodbye we 'll be back from 08:00 on monday , bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather updates as they happen .

if you have any photographs from around the county that you 'd like to share , or if there 's anything happening that you 'd like us to know about , you can contact us via email , facebook or twitter .

documents.title: weather : dry with clear spells and patchy cloud
text: this evening : staying dry with a mix of clear spells and patchy cloud , but also mist and fog patches developing quite widely .
minimum temperature : -2c ( 30f ) .
tomorrow : dry with early mist and fog patches slow to clear and patchy cloud with sunny intervals later .
author: Chris Bell
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: watch : mp back from myanmar democracy mission
text: norwich north mp chloe smith has just returned from a trip to myanmar , formerly known as burma , where she and other mps from around the world coached newly-elected representatives in the workings of parliamentary democracy .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: city centre route closes to traffic despite criticism of scheme
text: westlegate ( in norwich city centre will be closed to vehicles and golden ball street will become two-way from monday 21 march as part of the transport for norwich scheme .
the £ 3.05m scheme will give motorists easier access to car parks and restore all saints green as a traffic-free open space , norfolk county council said .
some of the changes to roads across norwich have attracted criticism which the city council has countered by offering residents the opportunity to send their comments for consideration .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: travel : a1064 open after sewage lorry crash
text: the a1064 road near acle has reopened fully to traffic after an overturned sewage tanker lying in a ditch was removed .
more details of traffic conditions on bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: final headlines : devolution for region likely to go ahead larger air ambulance takes off with blessing
text: here are tonight 's evening headlines :
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: final phase of £ 8m cromer protection scheme begins
text: the £ 8m cromer coast protection scheme is moving into its final phase on monday when work on surfacing the gangway parking area begins .

surfacing work will continue westwards towards the melbourne slope close to the pier and could be completed by the end of the month `` but with poor weather likely to hamper progress , substantial completion is expected in early april '' , north norfolk district council said .
council leader tom fitzpatrick said : `` this vital project will help protect cromer for years to come .
we have worked hard to minimise the impact on residents and businesses while ensuring the town can benefit from the scheme when the summer season arrives . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: key three face fitness race for norwich city
text: norwich city will make a late decision on three of their key players ahead of the visit of manchester city tomorrow .
robbie brady , steven naismith and sebastien bassong are all struggling with knocks .
andre wisdom is back training after long term injury but is unlikely to feature .
manager alex neil confirmed this lunchtime that midfielder alex tettey is out for the rest of the season .
i 'm not going to risk people if puts them out of later games ; it could hamstring us .
we need to make sure we are competitive tomorrow but we ca n't leave ourselves short going into this vital run-in .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: travel : congestion around great yarmouth
text: high volumes of traffic are causing congestion on roads each side of the river crossing in the centre of great yarmouth .
traffic is queuing along the southbound a149 between tar works road and the north quay junction as well as westbound towards school road .
on the a12 south of the river there is growing congestion northbound between the a1243 pasteur road and the a47 runham roundabout .
more details from bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: reavell rages as hornets suffer a humbling
text: here is the back page of today 's diss express :
author: Diss Express

documents.title: new larger air ambulance carries more medical equipment
text: the east anglian air ambulance fleet of helicopters has been expanded with a new larger aircraft to be based at norwich airport .
the new h145 helicopter is bigger than the ec135 it replaces and has a greater range for the service , which covers norfolk , suffolk , bedfordshire and cambridgeshire .
air ambulance chairman maj gen sir william cubitt , said the new aircraft would help enhance the service across the region as it could carry more medical equipment and supplies .
the air ambulance was blessed by the rt revd graham james , bishop of norwich , at a ceremony to launch its introduction to operations .
author: Wally Webb
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: skipper : 'i want to be britain 's greatest ironman '
text: norfolk athlete joe skipper wants to become the fastest-ever briton to complete an ironman triathlon this year .

he recently finished second at an event in new zealand , posting the third-fastest time ever for a briton after completing the grueling 2.4-mile swim , 112-mile bike ride and then running a marathon .
skipper told us : `` my big aim this year is to be the first british athlete under eight hours . `` .
he 's now targeting the world championship in hawaii in july .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: canaries strive to end sergio streak
text: here is the back page of today 's norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: weather : dry but cloudy with sunny spells
text: cloudy with bright or sunny spells in places but feeling slightly cooler than yesterday although winds remain light .
maximum temperature : 8c ( 46f ) .
tonight it will be dry with variable cloud cover but where skies remain clear fog and frost patches are possible .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: two men deny murder over great yarmouth fatal stabbing
text: two men who are accused of murder over a fatal stabbing in great yarmouth last november will stand trial later this year .
warren blake , 18 , of thorncliffe road in london , and tevin birmingham , 21 , of spring road in ipswich , both pleaded not guilty to murder at norwich crown court this morning .
andrew mcgowan , 33 , died after being stabbed at a property in dickens court in great yarmouth .
the two men are due to go on trial on 1 may .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: anglo-saxon gold declared to be treasure
text: a gold anglo-saxon mount found at sculthorpe near fakenham has been declared treasure at the coroner 's court in norwich .
the 2cm-wide item , dating from 6th-7th centuries , was found during a charity metal detecting event in a field .
the mount is now the property of the british museum and the independent portable antiquities scheme will decide how much money the landowner and the finder , barrie plasom , are entitled to .
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News

documents.title: travel : a140 congestion near norwich airport
text: there 's slow traffic on the a140 in both directions between the manor road junction in horsham st faiths and the b1149 holt road near norwich airport because of roadworks .
more details from bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: devolution : what does it mean ?
text: in essence , it 's the power to run more of our own services here in the east - instead of the westminster government taking these decisions .

this means local politicians based in norfolk , suffolk or cambridgeshire could be the ones to take control of things like transport , planning , health services , flood defences and further education .
but to do so , the government thinks we should form a super local authority - made up of norfolk , suffolk and cambridgeshire county councils , as well as the region 's city and district councils .
author: Deborah McGurran
BBC Political editor, East of England

documents.title: government 'likely to go ahead ' with eastern powerhouse devolution
text: i understand the government is likely to go ahead with an eastern powerhouse devolution deal , despite the fact that cambridge city council has decided not to take part .
their view is that one council 's decision to turn down the offer is not a barrier to a deal being agreed with the remaining 22 councils .
more details on bbc look east at 13:30 .
author: Tom Barton
BBC Look East political reporter

documents.title: lunchtime headlines : cambridge rejects devolution deal with norfolk two men plead not guilty to murder over fatal stabbing
text: here are the lunchtime headlines :
author: Graham Barnard
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: rail lines blocked after lorry hits bridge
text: # ipswich - due to a lorry hitting a railway bridge between stowmarket and ipswich all lines through these stations are blocked .
rh

documents.title: follow the leader to a great escape
text: here is the back page of friday 's eastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: crashed sewage tanker driver escapes serious injury
text: a driver has escaped serious injury after the sewage tanker he was driving left the a1064 in the early hours and overturned into a ditch , police have said .
traffic was held up during the morning rush hour as the liquid cargo was pumped into a replacement vehicle and the crashed lorry recovered .
the road is expected to be cleared later today but remained closed between the acle roundabout and main road in billockby at 11:00 .

documents.title: eadie backing canaries ' bid for premier league survival
text: former norwich city winger darren eadie insists his old club have what it takes to win their battle against premier league relegation .
the canaries are in the bottom three after going 10 games without a win .
they play manchester city at carrow road tomorrow lunchtime .

speaking on the scrimmage on bbc radio norfolk , eadie told us : `` i think norwich have played reasonably well ; the most important part is in the 18-yard boxes and that 's where they seem to be a little bit short . ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: £ 5 to spend a penny
text: here is the front page of today 's norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: cambridge city council joins county council in turning down devolution deal
text: cambridge city council has just confirmed to me it has rejected the government 's offer of a devolution deal .
the council says it is willing to carry on speaking to ministers and other local authorities about working together , but the offer on the table does n't meet its demands .
norfolk and suffolk are keen to join forces in a devolved local government - but cambridgeshire county council had previously rejected the offer .
author: Tom Barton
BBC Look East political reporter

documents.title: rare seabird spotted for first time at blakeney during wildlife survey
text: a survey at blakeney and brancaster on the north norfolk coast has led conservationists to discover some rare wildlife .
nearly 3,500 rare species were recorded during a survey of national trust sites during what it called a `` bio-blitz '' , and about a third of them were discovered in norfolk .
the first recorded sighting of the balearic shearwater at blakeney was made during the survey .
about 1,200 pairs pass through british waters on migration routes per year but few stay , according to the royal society for the protection of birds .

documents.title: at the scene : sewage tanker overturns near billockby
text: there is a long furrow ploughed into the verge of the a1064 towards acle bridge .
a tanker is lying on its side at the end of it , having veered off the road between billockby and acle in the early hours of this morning .
a label at the back of the vehicle declares it contains `` non-hazardous product '' .
another tanker has been brought in to pump out its liquid cargo , no doubt to lighten the load and help it out of the ditch , and a recovery vehicle is at the scene .
traffic has been queuing in either direction but police have been waving through vehicles and hold-ups are not severe .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: tragedy of a devoted dad
text: front page of friday 's eastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: charities helping child sex abuse victims fear funding shortage
text: reports to police of sex abuse involving children and young people are increasing in the county and charities looking after the victims are finding themselves under financial pressure .
many are claiming funding is becoming harder to find from donors and official or statutory sources .
mette ohrvik , chief executive of the sue lambert trust , said people were asking for help in increasing numbers and more resources were needed .
author: Nick Conrad
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: weather : becoming brighter after fog lifts
text: after a chilly and foggy start it will be a dry day with some bright or sunny spells .
feeling slightly cooler than yesterday although winds remaining light .
maximum temperature : 8c ( 46f ) .
more details on bbc weather .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: travel : a1064 road blocked by overturned sewage tanker near acle
text: the a1064 road is blocked in both directions between the a47 acle roundabout and the village of billockby after an accident involving a sewage tanker .
police are directing traffic and said drivers should approach the scene with care .
more details from bbc travel
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: travel : delays on rail services into liverpool street
text: abellio great anglia has apologised for delays to rail services into liverpool street due to overrunning engineering work last night but says services are returning to normal .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning and welcome to our live coverage for norfolk
text: hello and welcome to friday 's norfolk live .
between now and 18:00 , the team here will bring you the news , sport , travel and weather updates as we get them .
we 're always interested in what 's happening in your part of norfolk .
if there 's anything you wish to share with us you can contact us on email , facebook or twitter .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News
